breaks.text: Welcome to a game about settings menus. Yes, really. No, there's no 'actual game' hidden underneath. This is it. Enjoy?
Ah, your first locked setting. This is the core 'gameplay.' You'll be doing this for a while. Sorry about that.
You seem frustrated. Would you like me to just tell you the answer? [Hint: I can't. I'm just text in a JSON file.]
You're STILL playing this? At this point you're not configuring settings, you're making life choices. Questionable ones.
Punch cards. We've reached punch cards. I want you to really think about what you're doing with your time right now.
Quantum settings. The settings exist in superposition - both configured and unconfigured until you observe them. Which is nonsense, but so is this entire game.
You're now configuring the settings that configure the settings. If you're experiencing an existential crisis, that's working as intended.
You're almost at the end. Was it worth it? Will it ever be worth it? Are these questions the game is asking, or are you asking them? Yes.
This is it. The final layer. After all those settings menus, all that configuration, it comes down to this. I hope you're ready.
Quitting? Fair. I wouldn't want to configure any more settings either. Your progress has been... well, it exists.
Looking for help? Admirable. But the real help would have been not starting this game in the first place.
Error after error. Maybe the real error was starting this journey. (Too philosophical? Sorry, I've been watching you struggle.)
